vague_description: The task is to determine the boundary values of a fourth-moment expectation using provided parameters in a linear programming setup.
detailed_description:
PROBLEM TYPE
LP

INPUT FORMAT

{
    "K": \param{K},
    "p": [\param{P[i]} for i in 0, ..., \param{K}]
    "E[Z]": \param{ExpectedZ},
    "E[Z^2]": \param{ExpectedZSquared},
}

OBJECTIVE
Use linear programming to find lower and upper bounds on \param{E[Z^4]}.
target_objective: Determine the lower and upper bounds on the expected value of Z raised to the fourth power
target_constraints: Array p[i] is non-negative for each i in 1 to K
Lower and upper bounds for E[Z^4] should not be negative
target_parameters: Number of terms in the sequence
